page.title: 17INTERVIEW - Mr. C.W.BORRETT
page.content: As a child I remember hopscotch, skipping, jackstones, marbles, conkers and cat and doggy. There were Saturday matinees at the cinema, 1d. entrance and a bag of peanuts or a 'Monster' bag of sweets for another 1d. Sunday School was very popular especially the few weeks before Whitsun because on Whit Monday all the Sunday schools would join in procession through the streets to show their strength. After the parade there would be a free tea party followed by a chapel eisteddfod or 'sports'. I enjoyed reading The Bible and Boys' Own books and novels by Cooper, Verne and Dickens. I remember Queen Elizabeth II's coronation, my foster father, as chairman of Glamorgan County Council at the time, was invited.
